person.persName: Marshall Wright Chapin (Monroe County, Michigan, farmer and soldier.)

body.p: Monroe County, Michigan, farmer and soldier. Michigan native. Married to Louisa Vreeland Chapin. Father of Helen Chapin and Mary Chapin. Farmer in Monroe County, Michigan, in 1860. Employed John Kipp as a farm laborer in Monroe County in 1860. Served in the 4th Michigan Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a first lieutenant and captain from June 20, 1861. Served in the 23rd Michigan Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a colonel. Commanded the Thirty-Eighth Brigade of the 12th Division of the Army of the Ohio (U.S.A.) in October and November 1862. Commanded the Second Brigade of the 23rd Corps (U.S.A.) from July 1863 to April 15, 1864. Resigned on account of disability on April 15, 1864.
